name: LinkedIn Reaction Poll Generator
description: Reactions increase the reach of a post on LinkedIn similar to what happens on every other social media platform. Because of this, something I call 'reaction polls' have become really popular as a growth hack. Instead of running a regular LinkedIn poll, which is frankly pretty jank and constrained to 4 options, you can have users react to your post to vote on the option they want, creating a much richer experience that also nets you the poster a bunch of free engagement. An example is attached here as a project resource. Right now, there's no tool to make the generation of these reaction polls easy. Currently people wanting to run a reaction poll need to create their own image. In this project we'll create a tool that does it for them.

stories.name: HTML and CSS for the page
stories.description: General page structure minus the Reaction component covered in the Reaction Component story
requirements: The SVG that we'll be dynamically generating is primarily displayed
Reaction components are positioned inline below the page title and SVG
Poll title label and input positioned below the Reaction Components, left justified
Download label and button positioned below the Reaction Components, right justified

stories.name: Reaction Component
stories.description: The component that holds the reaction image, checkbox, and input
requirements: Dynamically display the five Reaction Components on the page instead of statically typing them out
When the user checks a Reaction Component checkbox that reaction is included in the SVG
As the user types in the Reaction Component label the value of the input is added to the SVG directly above the corresponding reaction
The user cannot type in an input unless the checkbox for that reaction is checked
If the user unchecks a Reaction Component then it is removed from the SVG

stories.name: SVG creation
stories.description: The SVG is dynamically updated as the user interacts with the Reaction Components
requirements: When the user checks a Reaction Component checkbox that reaction is included in the SVG
As the user types in the Reaction Component label the value of the input is added to the SVG directly above the corresponding reaction
When a reaction is added to the SVG draw an arrow from the reaction to it's label
The arrow is the same color (or a close match) as the reaction (ex. the arrow for the like reaction is blue)

stories.name: Poll title
stories.description: Adds the title of the poll to the SVG
requirements: As the user types in the Poll title input the value of the input is added to the SVG centered and positioned at the top of the SVG

stories.name: Download
stories.description: The user can download the newly created SVG to their device
requirements: When the user clicks the Download button the newly created SVG is downloaded to their device
